file_content.text: What remains of Darth Baras is yours, Wrath. He has gone to Korriban. Do as you must.
I'm going to make him pay for every indignity I have endured.
He will suffer greatly.
Fury must remain shy of blind.
This will be my greatest challenge.
The ultimate test awaits.
Baras's power is deep, hidden.
Korriban. I return to where it all began.
It comes full circle.
Darth Vowrawn returns to Korriban as well. Baras dare not strike at him within sight of the Dark Council.
The hinges are gone from the door.
Vowrawn will authorize your clearance to land and usher you into the Dark Council chamber.
Vowrawn is worthy of my loyalty.
He is a great ally.
Tell the old man to stay clear of the carnage.
He should remain hidden.
To stand among the Darths, you will need Vowrawn close.
I'd rather break down the door.
Don't need a doorman.
The Dark Council doesn't take kindly to intrusions, and Baras still has support there.
Vowrawn will back you, then you must express the Emperor's will.
Unleash the Emperor's Wrath!
It is done. The time to confront Darth Baras is now.
His leverage gone. Vowrawn preserved. Baras's bid to be named the Voice of the Emperor is crippled.
You have done well, Wrath. The Emperor is pleased.
But time never pauses.
Events are progressing faster. With the help of Armageddon Battalion, Darth Vowrawn has gained a foothold in the battle for Corellia.
Everything now hinges on Vowrawn's survival. Baras needs him dead to be named the Voice of the Emperor.
Send me to Corellia. I'll stop any attempt on Vowrawn's life.
I'll protect him.
The Wrath anticipates the Hand.
Has Baras made an attempt on Vowrawn's life?
Is he in danger?
Not yet. But it is imminent.
Nothing else would matter if Baras was taken out.
Why not just kill Baras?
For now, he is untouchable. But Vowrawn can grant you access to him.
Baras has marked Darth Vowrawn for death. Assassins have been sent. Their missions must end in failure.
We will learn more and brief you when you arrive on Corellia.
My lord, I'm afraid we cannot go to Corellia at this time. The Empire has enacted a martial law blockade of the entire system.
Tell me the details so we can figure out a way to overcome this.
What must be done?
I do not like being told no, Captain.
Unacceptable.
Believe me, I hate saying no, my lord.
I'd like to see someone try to get in my way.
Who's going to stop me?
The blockade is impenetrable.
The Imperial fleet has been equipped with special transponder signal emitters. Any ship without this emitter sticks out like a sore thumb.
Hmm. I never heard about such an initiative.
I've been monitoring Baras's communications, Lieutenant. He only implemented the order recently. Probably to keep us away from Corellia.
Without a signal emitter with Corellia space clearance, we will be noticed the minute we enter the system. But I believe I have a solution.
It shouldn't be too difficult to secure an emitter.
Let me guess--we steal one.
As always, you have great clarity of mind, my lord.
That's what I love about you most, Quinn. You're my answer man.
[Flirt] You always do.
It is a job that has come with great rewards.
That's why I keep you around, Quinn. You're my answer man.
You always do.
It has been an honor to be that, my lord.
You're trying my patience, Captain. Just tell me what you've got.
Out with it.
I intercepted a transmission granting Corellia clearance to a class-A starship not far from here.
Lucky us.
Quite. We can board the vessel and take their signal emitter.
They won't part with it easily. We'll have to go in there guns blazing. A lot of fellow Imperials are going to die.
It's for the larger good, Lieutenant.
Regrettable but necessary.
Too bad for them
It will be tough going. The crew of this ship is seasoned.
That doesn't sit well with me either, Lieutenant.
I don't like killing our own.
Nor with me, but it is a necessary evil. There are ways to minimize the casualties.
I know the schematics of class-A starships by heart. I could accompany you on board and lead you directly to the transponder station.
Just a suggestion. But it would help expedite things.
I have completed my mission on Voss. The Voice of the Emperor has been freed.
Yes. We are again aware of the Voice. Preparations are being made to secure a new host, but the rituals take time.
Your disruption of Baras's plans continues. There is crucial need for you now on a planet called Voss.
What is to be achieved there?
What's my mission?
A decisive blow to the betrayer's bid.
What should I know about this planet?
Tell me about Voss.
Much more unknown than known.
Our awareness of this planet and its people is relatively new.
I'll head that way.
The Wrath is resolute.
Baras laid the seeds for his ascension on Voss many years ago. We will explain when you arrive.
Wrath, Servant Two sensed the presence of Baras's apprentice, Draahg.
Hidden in life; announced in death.
It seems our enemy knows you live. We have lost the advantage of surprise.
Now Draahg is dead. Baras's power has taken a hit.
But gained other advantages.
What he wields is autonomous.
I prefer to operate out in the open anyway.
Good.
Now the Wrath can be unrestrained.
Baras is a master of information. It was only a matter of time before he learned the truth.
It was inevitable.
Your knowledge of him is deep.
Darth Vowrawn is receiving his reinforcements on Corellia. This and the loss of Draahg will incense Baras. He will tighten his grip.
The key Dark Council member who opposes Baras's attempt to be named Voice of the Emperor is Darth Vowrawn.
Vowrawn is spearheading the battle for Corellia, and Baras secretly undermines his efforts. He hopes to orchestrate Vowrawn's failure, or death.
Baras is willing to risk losing Corellia?
He's undermining the war?
His personal goals override the war.
What will Baras gain if Vowrawn fails or dies?
Explain Vowrawn's importance.
The pendulum swings with Vowrawn's weight.
So now I have to win the battle for Corellia?
You want me to fight the war?
The Wrath is not being drafted.
Vowrawn alone holds the defiant council members together. Baras's attempts to weaken his Corellia campaign must be thwarted.
The Empire's Armageddon Battalion was to be assigned to Corellia, but Baras redirected it to Hoth, where its strength is being wasted.
General Greist commands. He must be convinced to abandon Baras's orders and take Armageddon Battalion to Corellia.
Tell me about the general--will he be easy to convince?
Will Greist cooperate?
It will be done.
Guess I better break out my winter gear again.
So, I return to Hoth.
I served with General Greist for a time, my lord. As tough as they come. And stubborn.
Resistance cannot be accepted. Armageddon Battalion must be reassigned. Do whatever it takes to make it happen.
Great. Back to the deep freeze.
Broonmark returns to Hoth. Can track our target.
No offense to Broonmark's tracking skills, but Hoth is big. It could take a long time to find Greist.
Hoth is a big place, my lord. It could take a long time to find Greist.
Commander Slinte is Baras's man there. He'll know where to find Armageddon Battalion.
I have a contact.
Ah, yes. Excellent thinking, my lord.
We'll lean on every Imperial we see until we find one who can direct us.
Someone there knows.
Ah, yes, I see where you're going with this, my lord. Baras's man Commander Slinte is stationed on Hoth.
The Hand said this is critical. However long it takes, it takes.
So be it.
Wait. My lord, I may have a way to expedite your mission.
When you were last on Hoth, Baras killed Commander Lanklyn and replaced him with Commander Slinte. Slinte probably knows where to find Armageddon Battalion.
Of course, Baras is rather tough on underlings. Assuming Slinte hasn't been disposed of, he's your best lead.
Time to look up an old friend.
About to have a reunion.
Let's hope he's been an obedient little soldier.
Good point.
If he falls short, there's about to be a job opening on Hoth.
He better hope he can help me.
The Wrath ascends.
Darth Ekkage will not be joining her brother.
Yes, with Baras's sister silenced, our enemy grows angry. But he has other endeavors that must fail.
Wrath, your first opportunity to tear down what Baras creates is on Belsavis, a planet that was hidden from the Empire until recently.
We are sending coordinates and will advise you when you've arrived.
My lord, when Servant One contacted the ship in your absence, I didn't know what to make of it.
So, it's true? You've been chosen as the Emperor's Wrath. And we now fight against Darth Baras.
So, the weirdos were telling the truth--Baras snaked us, huh? And now we're going after him.
Vengeance feeds us. The clan must be cleansed!
Didn't care for old man Baras anyway.
Never liked that old man anyway.
We climb closer to the Emperor, master. Closer to ultimate power!
You have maneuvered even closer to the heart of the Empire. Great strides can be made.
I don't know, those Hand weirdos kind of creep me out. You sure you want to sign up for this?
Everything has changed, Vette. My old master is my new enemy.
Baras must pay.
Great. I'll update my score card.
Don't worry, Vette, I won't be caught off guard again. My eyes will be open.
I'll see as I go.
Yeah, mine, too. Even while I'm sleeping.
My lord, the ship is ready for departure. I'll await your word.
My lord, after all this time with Baras, it's difficult to reconcile that we are enemies now.
We were faithful, Quinn. Our old master is to blame for this.
It's Baras's doing.
So it would seem, my lord.
You know Baras the best, Quinn. I need you focused for what's to come.
Get over it.
My mind will find clarity, my lord. I promise.
The ship is ready for departure when you are. I will await the word.
Did I ask for input? When I seek your opinions, you'll know it.
Shut up, everyone.
Ready the ship for departure.
A solution?
